data.title: The Best 'RuPaul's Drag Race' Seasons, Ranked By Fans
data.meta_description: Over 1K TV viewers have voted on the 10+ items on Best 'RuPaul's Drag Race' Seasons, Ranked By Fans. Current Top 3: RuPaul's Drag Race - Season 6, RuPaul's ...
data.text:
Ranked By

8.7K votes

1.5K voters

Voting Rules

RuPaul's Drag Race, a pioneering reality competition television series, has delighted audiences and reshaped the landscape of drag culture worldwide since its debut in 2009. Each season of the show introduces viewers to a dazzling array of contestants, all vying for the coveted title of "America's Next Drag Superstar." With host RuPaul Charles at the helm as mentor and head judge, the series blends charisma, uniqueness, nerve, and talent into mesmerizing challenges that test the limits of creativity and resilience.

The best seasons of RuPaul's Drag Race are distinguished by more than just glamorous runway looks and fierce lip sync battles; they are celebrated for their memorable moments and the indelible marks they leave on pop culture. Who can forget the iconic showdown between Alyssa Edwards and Coco Montrese in Season 5? Similarly, Season 6's "Snatch Game" highlights the comedic prowess of Bianca Del Rio, solidifying her status as one of the most beloved racers in the franchise's history.

Moreover, RuPaul's Drag Race fosters an ever-evolving platform of representation, breaking ground with the inclusion of the first openly transgender contestants and the first heterosexual, cisgender male contestant in recent seasons. This commitment to diversity reflects and celebrates the multifaceted nature of the drag community.

The appeal of RuPaul's Drag Race lies in its consistent delivery of high-stakes drama, spellbinding performances, and genuine connections. Each season builds on its predecessors, inspiring admiration and conversation as viewers eagerly await the next installment.

Latest additions: RuPaul's Drag Race - Season 16

Over 1.5K Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The Best 'RuPaul's Drag Race' Seasons, Ranked By Fans

1

RuPaul's Drag Race - Season 6

The sixth season of RuPaul's Drag Race premiered on February 24, 2014 and contains 14 episodes. This season initially splits the contestants into two groups who compete against each other.

Contestants Of RuPaul's Drag Race Season 6: Bianca Del Rio, Adore Delano, Courtney Act, Darienne Lake, BenDeLaCreme, Joslyn Fox, Trinity K. Bonet, Laganja Estranja, Milk, Gia Gunn, April Carrión, Vivacious, Magnolia Crawford, and Kelly Mantle.

This season features several unforgettable episodes including "Scream Queens," "Queens of Talk," and "Glitter Ball."

Memorable Moments From Season 6 Include:

The contestants create horror movies.

Bianca impersonates Judge Judy.

The racers interview Chaz Bono and Georgia Holt.

Lip Sync Songs From Season 6:

"Express Yourself" (Madonna)

"Turn the Beat Around" (Vicki Sue Robinson)

"Shake It Up" (Selena Gomez)

"I'm Every Woman" (Chaka Khan)

"Head to Toe" (Lisa Lisa & Cult Jam)

"Whatta Man" (Salt-n-Pepa with En Vogue)

"Point of No Return" (Exposé)

"Stupid Girls" (Pink)

"Vibeology" (Paula Abdul)

"Think" (Aretha Franklin)

"Stronger (What Doesn't Kill You)" (Kelly Clarkson)

"Sissy That Walk" (RuPaul)

Why It's A Standout Season: Season 6 is frequently hailed as one of the best seasons due to its strong cast and dramatic twists. Bianca Del Rio's sharp wit and impeccable sewing skills lead her to victory, while contestants like Adore Delano and Courtney Act win viewers' hearts. The season’s split-premiere introduces a fresh format, and challenges like the "Snatch Game" feature stellar performances, particularly by BenDeLaCreme as Maggie Smith.

Did this season shantay?

2

RuPaul's Drag Race - Season 5

The fifth season of RuPaul's Drag Race premiered on January 28, 2013 and contains 14 episodes. This season is the first to feature a double elimination.

Contestants Of RuPaul's Drag Race Season 5: Jinkx Monsoon, Alaska, Roxxxy Andrews, Detox, Coco Montrese, Alyssa Edwards, Ivy Winters, Jade Jolie, Lineysha Sparx, Honey Mahogany, Vivienne Pinay, Monica Beverly Hillz, Serena ChaCha, and Penny Tration.

This season features several unforgettable episodes including "Lip Synch Extravaganza Eleganza," "Can I Get an Amen?," and "Sugar Ball."

Memorable Moments From Season 5 Include:

The racers roast RuPaul and the judges.

Wilmer Valderrama hosts a Latin telenovela acting challenge.

The contestants design candy couture.

Lip Sync Songs From Season 5:

"Party in the U.S.A." (Miley Cyrus)

"Only Girl (In the World)" (Rihanna)

"When I Grow Up" (The Pussycat Dolls)

"Oops!... I Did It Again" (Britney Spears)

"Take Me Home" (Cher)

"I'm So Excited" (The Pointer Sisters)

"Whip My Hair" (Willow Smith)

"Ain't Nothin' Goin' on But the Rent" (Gwen Guthrie)

"Cold Hearted" (Paula Abdul)

"(It Takes) Two to Make It Right" (Seduction)

"Malambo No. 1" (Yma Sumac)

"The Beginning" (RuPaul)

Why It's A Standout Season: Season 5 crowns Jinkx Monsoon, the quirky and lovable performer with a killer sense of humor. The season features iconic moments such as Alyssa Edwards and Coco Montrese's longstanding feud and Alaska’s witty catchphrases. Fans adore the epic "Snatch Game," where Jinkx’s portrayal of Little Edie becomes legendary. The cast is filled with memorable personalities that have continued to be fan favorites.

Did this season shantay?

3

RuPaul's Drag Race - Season 9

The ninth season of RuPaul's Drag Race premiered on March 24, 2017 and contains 14 episodes. This season sees Season 8 contestant Cynthia Lee Fontaine getting another chance.

Contestants Of RuPaul's Drag Race Season 9: Sasha Velour, Peppermint, Shea Couleé, Trinity Taylor, Alexis Michelle, Nina Bo'nina Brown, Valentina, Farrah Moan, Aja, Cynthia Lee Fontaine, Eureka, Charlie Hides, Kimora Blac, and Jaymes Mansfield.

This season features several unforgettable episodes including "Oh. My. Gaga!," "Good Morning B*tches," and "Reality Stars: The Musical."

Memorable Moments From Season 9 Include:

Lady Gaga poses as a contestant.

The contestants interview Naya Rivera.

The final four face-off in a lip sync showdown.

Lip Sync Songs From Season 9:

"Love Shack" (The B-52's)

"Holding Out for a Hero" (Bonnie Tyler)

"I Wanna Go" (Britney Spears)

"Woman Up" (Meghan Trainor)

"Music" (Madonna)

"Finally" (Cece Peniston)

"Baby I'm Burning" (Dolly Parton)

"Greedy" (Ariana Grande)

"Cool for the Summer" (Demi Lovato)

"Macho Man" (Village People)

"U Wear It Well" (RuPaul)

Why It's A Standout Season: Season 9 introduces the show to a broader audience on VH1 and crowns Sasha Velour after a dramatic final lip sync where she spills rose petals from her wig. The season is noted for its heartfelt moments, such as Peppermint’s coming out as transgender during the competition. Viewers also witness the elimination of Valentina for failing to prepare her lip sync lyrics.

Did this season shantay?

4

RuPaul's Drag Race - Season 4

The fourth season of RuPaul's Drag Race premiered on January 30, 2012 and contains 14 episodes. This season is the first in series history to feature two runners-up.

Contestants Of RuPaul's Drag Race Season 4: Sharon Needles, Chad Michaels, Phi Phi O'Hara, Latrice Royale, Kenya Michaels, DiDa Ritz, Willam, Jiggly Caliente, Milan, Madame LaQueer, The Princess, Lashauwn Beyond, and Alisa Summers.

This season features several unforgettable episodes including "RuPocalypse Now!," "Glamazons vs. Champions," and "The Final Three."

Memorable Moments From Season 4 Include:

The contestants compete in a G.L.O.W.-like wrestling competition.

The racers engage in a political debate.

All three finalists perform the lip sync song.

Lip Sync Songs From Season 4:

"Toxic" (Britney Spears)

"Bad Girls" (Donna Summer)

"This Will Be (An Everlasting Love)" (Natalie Cole)

"Trouble" (Pink)

"Vogue" (Madonna)

"Born This Way" (Lady Gaga)

"Mi Vida Loca" (Pam Tillis)

"It's Raining Men (The Sequel)" (Martha Wash and RuPaul)

"I've Got to Use My Imagination" (Gladys Knight)

"(You Make Me Feel Like) A Natural Woman" (Aretha Franklin)

"No One Else on Earth" (Wynonna Judd)

"Glamazon" (RuPaul)

Why It's A Standout Season: Season 4 is often cited as a turning point, as it introduces a higher production value and darker themes. Sharon Needles's spooky, alternative drag earns her the crown, representing a shift away from conventional beauty queens. Moments like the "WTF! Wrestling" challenge and the fiercely competitive lip sync between Dida Ritz and The Princess captivate audiences. Latrice Royale’s heartwarming presence and professionalism also make this season unforgettable.

Did this season shantay?

5

RuPaul's Drag Race - Season 12

The twelfth season of RuPaul's Drag Race premiered on February 28, 2020 and contains 14 episodes. This season faced controversy; contestant Sherry Pie was disqualified and mostly edited out of the show after revelations of misconduct were confirmed. The finale was held virtually.

Contestants Of RuPaul's Drag Race Season 12: Crystal Methyd, Gigi Goode, Jaida Essence Hall, Sherry Pie, Jackie Cox, Heidi N Closet, Widow Von'Du, Jan, Brita, Aiden Zhane, Nicky Doll, Rock M. Sakura, and Dahlia Sin.

This season features several unforgettable episodes including "World's Worst," "Gay's Anatomy," and "Madonna: The Unauthorized Rusical."

Memorable Moments From Season 12 Include:

The racers write and record an original Fosse-inspired jazz number.

Whoopi Goldberg is the audience for the solo show challenge.

The contestants design an extravagant and unnecessary product to sell in an infomercial.

Lip Sync Songs From Season 12:

"Call Your Girlfriend" (Robyn)

"Problem" (Ariana Grande ft. Iggy Azalea)

"S&M" (Rihanna)

"Heart to Break" (Kim Petras)

"Let It Go" (Caissie Levy)

"Burning Up" (Madonna)

"This Is My Night" (Chaka Khan)

"Firework" (Katy Perry)

"Kill the Lights" (Alex Newell and DJ Cassidy ft. Nile Rodgers)

"1999" (Prince)

"On the Floor" (Jennifer Lopez ft. Pitbull)

"Bring Back My Girls" (RuPaul)

"I'm Like A Bird" (Nelly Furtado)

"Take On Me" (A-Ha)

"Get Up" (Ciara)

"Survivor" (Destiny's Child)

Why It's A Standout Season: Despite the challenges of the COVID-19 pandemic, Season 12 delivers high-quality entertainment and crowns Jaida Essence Hall. The season is marked by strong performances from Gigi Goode and Crystal Methyd, who bring creativity and humor. Sherry Pie's disqualification is a significant moment, but it doesn't overshadow the remarkable talent on display. The remote finale, a first for the franchise, showcases the racers' resilience and inventiveness.

Did this season shantay?

6

RuPaul's Drag Race - Season 3

The third season of RuPaul's Drag Race premiered on January 24, 2011 and contains 16 episodes. This season, Michelle Visage replaces Merle Ginsberg as a judge.

Contestants Of RuPaul's Drag Race Season 3: Raja, Manila Luzon, Alexis Mateo, Yara Sofia, Carmen Carrera, Shangela, Delta Work, Stacy Layne Matthews, Mariah, India Ferrah, Mimi Imfurst, Phoenix, and Venus D-Lite.

This season features several unforgettable episodes including "Queens in Space," "Face, Face, Face of Cakes," and “The Hair Ball.”

Memorable Moments From Season 3 Include:

The racers make a fitness video with Susan Powter.

Delta gives her family phone call prize to Shangela.

The contestants perform stand-up comedy.

Lip Sync Songs From Season 3:

"The Right Stuff" (Vanessa Williams)

"Bad Romance" (Lady Gaga)

"Don't Leave Me This Way" (Thelma Houston)

"Meeting in the Ladies Room" (Klymaxx)

"Looking for a New Love" (Jody Watley)

"Knock on Wood" (Amii Stewart)

"MacArthur Park" (Donna Summer)

"Mickey (Spanish version)" (Toni Basil)

"Believe" (Cher)

"Even Angels" (Fantasia Barrino)

"Straight Up" (Paula Abdul)

"I Think About You" (Patti LaBelle)

"Champion (DJ BunJoe's Olympic Mix)" (RuPaul)

Why It's A Standout Season: With Michelle Visage joining the judging panel, Season 3 brings new levels of glamour and drama. Raja's high-fashion prowess leads her to victory, while memorable performers like Manila Luzon and Alexis Mateo become instant fan favorites. The return of Shangela as a wildcard contestant creates exciting twists. Iconic moments like Raja and Carmen Carrera’s nearly-naked lip sync performance cement this season as a classic.

Did this season shantay?
